abstract: Transatlantic Holdings and Allied World Assurance called off their proposed $2.94 billion merger after the two insurers faced stiff shareholder opposition.
snippet: Transatlantic Holdings and Allied World Assurance called off their proposed $2.94 billion merger after the two insurers faced stiff shareholder opposition.
lead_paragraph: Transatlantic Holdings and Allied World Assurance called off their proposed $2.94 billion merger on Friday after the two insurers faced stiff shareholder opposition and two rival bids for Transatlantic. Transatlantic has been fending off a higher $3.01 billion takeover bid by another reinsurer, Validus Holdings, and had been in talks with a unit of Berkshire Hathaway that had offered $3.25 billion.

headline.main: Transatlantic and Allied Cancel Merger Plans
headline.print_headline: Transatlantic and Allied Cancel Merger Plans

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
